author: infamousrev
content:
Every time the difficulty bomb gets delayed the PoW miners will gladly accept it.
When the time comes that the TTD has to be set it may help if this gets packaged together with another difficulty bomb delay (Positive change+Negative change for the miners).
Therefore it may be better to delay less now, and split it up into two smaller delays (The second hardfork including the TTD).

author: 0xsadcat
content: Interestingly the merge fork itself doesn't have to be installed by the miners at all. It's enough if everyone else does

author: infamousrev
content: Yes but many PoW will simply fail to switch off their miners because they wont have a very good alternative chain to switch to. If there are no good options many of them will choose to do nothing and just see what happens. If they already accepted the TTD hardfork and are already running that software it will make the chance of the PoW chain surviving much smaller. If the TTD hardfork is not packaged with any benefit to the miners most of them will just ignore it and when TTD happens the PoW chain will survive with a significant amount of mining power, a bit like the ETH and ETC split.

author: infamousrev
content: When faced with only bad options most people will choose to simply do nothing, which in this case means keeping the miners turned on and mining the PoW chain

author: 0xsadcat
content: That's why the difficulty bomb exists (and why not delaying it would be better, but too late)

author: infamousrev
content: What I mean is, that if for example 3 months delay is needed, then it may be better to delay 2 months first, and then another 1 month packaged together with the TTD. Since the TTD is basically like a poison pill for the PoW miners it may be better to package it together with some benefit for them like another 1-2 month of mining. There is currently no coordinated effort to keep the PoW chain alive, but it could be kept alive anyway due to the tendency of people to default to doing nothing when faced with only bad options.
